page.title: 14A Sunny Morning in Bolney.
page.content: The sun shines through my yellow curtains and turns the room all gold.I have breakfast and go to let out the geese who make an awful racket. The air is fresh and the cobwebs look like silver threads. The moon is still out, a big silver ball in a light blue sky. Rabbits scurry away, clouds look like chunks of cotton wool and trees sway gently. Along the lane the cows look at us with huge brown eyes across flowery hedges and honeysuckle and wild roses smell lovely. But when we get to the A272 it is all noise, with cars whizzing up and down. In the village street it is all quiet again, except for the children coming to school, laughing and chattering and birds singing. The church bell chimes quarter to nine and we play in the sun until it is time to go in to school.
